owl:Ontology.terms:description: Ontosoft is an ontology to describe software.
owl:Ontology.terms:title: The Ontosoft ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: Ontosoft is an ontology to describe software

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: This property annotation indicates if a property is a required property or not
This property annotation provides information to be handed over to search engines (like Solr) to explain how to tokenize and index the property values
This property annotation provides UI specific information for the property like positioning, special UI interface, etc

owl:ObjectProperty.dc:description: How is the software being developed or maintained?
Has the software been adopted in a project, organization or by a person?
Do you know how long it takes to run this software version on average?
Is there any benchmark information about the software?
Are there any bug fixes that affects this software version?
What is the URL for the citation?
What is the text associated with the Citation?
What is the URL for the code?
How can a user get support for the software? (eg. Report bugs, request features and extensions, etc)
What software can this software be composed with in a workflow?
Is this software typically used with other software in a workflow? (eg: for visualization, preprocessing, postprocessing, etc)
Who created this software? (Project, Organization, Person, Initiative, etc.)
What other software does the software version require to be installed?
Is there any docker image available for this software version?
What is the docker image id?
How to run the docker image instruction?
What is the URL for pulling this docker image?
Is there any on-line documentation about this software version?
What are the domain specific keywords for this software version?
What is the e-mail contact for this software?
What is the URL for the executable?
What functions does this software version have?
What is the invocation line for this function?
What are the funding sources for this software?
What language(s) is this software version written in?
What input files does this function require?
What is the argument for this input file?
What is the data format for this input file?
What is the input file type?
What is the default value for this input?
What is the input description?
What is the input name?
What are the input parameters used for this function?
What is the argument for this input parameter?
What is the parameter type?
What is the default value for this input parameter?
What is the parameter description?
What is this parameter name?
How can one install this software version?
What other software can interoperate with this one?
What known issues does this software version have?
What description does this known issues have?
What is the latest software version for this software?
What license is the code released under?
Are there any major contributors of note for this software version?
What is the software called?
Are there any other important details about the implementation of this code (parallelization, special hardware, etc)?
What outputs does this function produce?
What is the argument for this output?
What is the data format for this output?
What is the File I/O type?
What is the default value for this output?
What is the output description?
What is the output name?
Provide a Twitter handle, ORCID Id, email address, github URL, home page, or any other unique identifier for this person
Is there a preferred publication or citation for this software?
Is there a preferred publication or citation for this software version?
Is there a project website for the software?
Who is the publisher of this software?
What are the ratings for this software?
Are there any relevant data catalogs that can be used with this software version?
What other useful features of this software version are worth highlighting?
What are the general categories (keywords, labels) associated with the software?
What changes does this software version have compared to the previous one?
What is the change description?
What is the software change type?
Is there any on-line resource for accessing the software community? (eg. Mailing-list, discussion board, wiki, etc)
When was the software created?
What is the description for this software?
What is the support offered for this software?
What versions does this software have?
What is the description for this software version?
When is the limit date of support for this version?
What is the software version type (e.g., stable, major version)?
Do you have any test data for this software version?
Can you describe the test data?
What is the URL for test data?
Are there any specific instructions for testing this software version?
What is the DOI or any other unique identifier for this software?
Is there any information about uses of this software version (paper DOIs, research labs, etc)?
Are there any constraints on use, situations it is not designed for, simplifications?
Are there any usage statistics for this software?
What are the recommended uses and assumptions for this software version?
What is the software version id?
When was this version released?
Describe the workflow?
Are there any memory requirements for this software version?
Is there any other similar software that you know of?
Which versions replace the current version?
What version does this software version supersede?
What Operating Systems can this software version run on?
Are there any publications where this software version is used?
What is the algorithm used in this function?

A revision is a derivation for which the resulting entity is a revised version of some original. The implication here is that the resulting entity contains substantial content from the original. Revision is a particular case of derivation.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An agent that adopts software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software Adopter

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Software benchmarking information
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Benchmark Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Used for citing publications with citation next and a citation location
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Citation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Text associated with a citation
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Citation Text

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Information about any on-line resource for accessing the software community (Mailing-list, discussion board, wiki, etc)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Community Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An entity composed of multiple entities
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Complex Entity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Describes composition of a software with others in a workflow
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Composition

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Software development/maintenance description
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Development Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Information about how to run the docker image of this software.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Docker image instruction Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An entity that provides enumeration instances
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Enumeration Entity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Software function invocation information
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software function invocation Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A text based identifier
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Identifier

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Details about implementation of the code (parallelization, etc)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Implementation Details

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Indicates a file based input to, or file based output from a software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: File I/O

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Comma separated keywords associated with the software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Keywords

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A class of licenses that the software is released under
owl:Class.rdfs:label: License

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Location URL
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Location

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A numeric value with units
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Measurement Entity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A numeric entity
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Numeric Entity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Operating Systems that the software runs on
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Operating System

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Person identifier class
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Person

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The class of programming languages
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Programming Language

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An agent that publishes software.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software Publisher

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Rating of a software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Rating

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Software is any piece of code that is described in Ontosoft. This could some visualisation software, software package, library, componentised scripts, etc. This can be subclassed if software categories with extra properties are required, otherwise one should use SoftwareTag to categorise software.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A software can be tagged with multiple categories. Multiple instances can be created of this, and it can also be subclassed to have hierarchical categories
owl:Class.rdfs:label: SoftwareCategory

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An informal text-based description of software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software Description

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A version of a piece of software described by ontosoft
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software Version

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TestData is used to describe test datasets for the software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Test Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Description of the Test Data provided
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TestData Description

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Instructions on how to run the test with the provided test data including test cases, setup instructions, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Test Instructions

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A text entity
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Text Entity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Information about uses of this software (paper dois, research labs, etc)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Usage Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Statistics about software use (downloads, frequency of use, etc)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Usage Statistics

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Constraints on use of the software, any simplifications, situations it isn't designed for
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Use Limitations

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Description of how the software is used, and any assumptions made for using the software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Uses and Assumptions

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Describes use of the software with other software in a workflow
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Workflow Description

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Indicates a parameter used by a software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Parameter
